result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew A Reynolds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: There are 83 days credit for time served for this case which is not duplicate to credit given in 15CF1914 or 16CF629.

miscConds.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.   Not to enter bars, liquor stores or other establishments whose primary business is the sale of alcohol.

Provide DNA sample if not previously provided.  Pay DNA surcharge, costs of supervision and court obligations.  Obey all rules and regulations of supervising agent.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Attend 5 self-help groups per week for the first year and provide written verification of attendance to agent.  Do not associate with persons using, possessing or selling controlled substances.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Matthew A Reynolds in court with attorney Jason Sanders.  Defendant Matthew A Reynolds in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jason Sanders
Preliminary hearing at 09-16-2015 08:30 am

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Matthew A Reynolds in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Matthew A Reynolds in custody.  Brian Van Schyndel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  
Defense motions to dismiss CT 1 based upon lack of probable cause. 
State objects to the motion to dismiss
BTC: Motion to dismiss CT 1 is denied. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
